Robot

Class Navigator

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • Robot.Navigator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Navigator
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class accomplishes the task of Navigation, that is, it is responsible for sending commands to the motors to go to a coordinate. In addition to movement, this class can also rotate the robot to a certain heading using an Odometer. The methods in this class are all private and non static. The variables used in this navigator are private but this class uses a few public variables from the main method.
    Author:
    Thomas, Aagnik

    • Field Detail

      • destDistance

        public double[] destDistance
        The array that stores the x and y coordinates for the destination (in cm). destDistance[0] will store x, destDistance[1] will store y.

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double destX,
            double destY)
        Public method that is called outside of navigator to give navigator the command to move to a certain coordinate.

        Stores the destination x and y coordinates inside destDistance[]. Calls getDestAngle to calculate the desired heading. Raises the isNavigating flag.
        Parameters:
        destX -
        destY -

      • getDestAngle

        public double getDestAngle(int x,
                  int y)

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double destTheta)
        Sends command to left and right motors to turn a certain about of degrees so that the robot will turn to a desired heading. The turn itself will be a minimal turn ie. A turn CW/CCW of >180 degrees will be a turn CCW/CW of (360 - the desired >180 degrees). All angles in this method are in radians.

        Relies on WHEEL_RADIUS and TRACK to calculate each motor's rotation (in radians).
        Parameters:
        destTheta - The desired heading that you want to robot to turn to.
